{{Nihongo|'''Masashi Oguro'''|å¤§é» å°å¿|Åguro Masashi|extra=born 4 May 1980}} is a Japanese [[Association football|football]] player from [[Toyonaka, Osaka|Toyonaka]] in [[Osaka Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. He plays the [[Striker|forward]] position.
==Club career== Oguro joined the [[J-league]] in 1999, with [[Gamba Osaka]]. He was loaned to [[Consadole Sapporo]] for the 2001 season, and returned to Gamba having impressed many in Osaka.
In 2004, Oguro scored the second highest number of goals in the [[J-league]], and the highest number of all Japanese-born players. In [[Kanji|Chinese characters]], Oguro's name resembles that of the god [[Daikokuten]], giving him that nickname. [[Gamba Osaka]]'s official merchandise store has come to be called the ''`Shrine of Daikokuten`''.
In 2005, Oguro was the 6th top [[J-league]] scorer, and helped led [[Gamba Osaka]] to the [[J-league]] championship.
In December 2005, Oguro was signed by French club [[Grenoble Foot 38]], a club where he would appear in 17 [[Ligue 2]] matches.<ref>{{Lfpfr|first=Masashi|last=Oguro}}</ref>
In August 2006, Oguro was transferred to Italian club [[Torino F.C.|Torino]].
In June 2008, Oguro moved to [[J. League]] side [[Tokyo Verdy]].<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Guardian.co.uk]]|title=Stats Centre: Masashi Oguro Facts|url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/StatsCentre.asp?CTID=63&CPID=152&TEID=3545&PLID=65473&pStr=Player|accessdate=2009-12-22}}</ref>
He moved to [[Yokohama F.C.]] in January 2010 on a loan deal.
==International career== Oguro was chosen for the [[Japan national football team|Japanese national team]] in 2005 for the [[2006 FIFA World Cup qualification|2006 World Cup qualifying games]]. During his second game for the team on February 9, Oguro scored the clinching goal in injury time to win 2-1 over [[North Korea national football team|North Korea]] in the final game of [[2006 FIFA World Cup (qualification AFC)|Asian qualification]].
In 2005, Oguro was the 5th top scorer for the [[Japan national football team|Japanese national team]].
In May 2006, Oguro was called up to play for Japan in the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]] in [[Germany]].
